title: A beginner’s guide to using Signal
snippets: Signal, a messaging app, gained significant attention after The Atlantic's editor-in-chief, Jeffrey Goldberg, was accidentally added to a group chat with top military officials discussing an airstrike. This incident, reported on Monday, brought the app into the spotlight.
summary: Signal, a messaging app, was highlighted after an incident where The Atlantic's editor-in-chief, Jeffrey Goldberg, was mistakenly added to a group chat with high-ranking military officials talking about an airstrike. This event was reported on Monday and has since brought increased attention to the app.

title: Here’s what military planning usually looks like — and why it doesn’t include Signal
snippets: The Trump administration officials, including Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth and Vice President JD Vance, used a Signal group chat to plan a military strike on Houthi targets in Yemen, as reported by The Atlantic.
summary: Trump administration officials, such as Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth and Vice President JD Vance, utilized a Signal group chat to coordinate a military strike on Houthi targets in Yemen, according to The Atlantic.

title: Madison Square Garden’s surveillance system banned this fan over his T-shirt design

title: Trump pardons ex-Nikola CEO Trevor Milton
snippets: Trevor Milton, the founder of Nikola Motors, was pardoned by President Donald Trump after being convicted of defrauding investors by lying about the capabilities of his zero-emission truck company, including claims about building its own electric truck, the Nikola One. The White House confirmed the pardon on Friday.
summary: Trevor Milton, founder of Nikola Motors, was pardoned by President Donald Trump following his conviction for defrauding investors with false claims about his company's zero-emission trucks. The White House confirmed the pardon on Friday.

title: Google’s Pixel 9A will launch on April 10th
snippets: Google will launch the Pixel 9A in the US, Canada, and the UK on April 10th, following a delay due to a component quality issue. The budget-friendly smartphone was initially expected to launch after its March 19th reveal. It will be released in the rest of Europe at a later date.
summary: Google is set to release the Pixel 9A in the US, Canada, and the UK on April 10th, after a delay caused by a component quality issue. Originally planned to launch following its March 19th reveal, the budget-friendly smartphone will be available in the rest of Europe at a future date.

title: NASA and Boeing investigate Starliner’s ‘anomalies’ before its next crewed flight

summary: NASA and Boeing are working to resolve technical issues with the Starliner spacecraft, aiming to prepare it for a possible crewed mission later this year or early next year. These problems had earlier hindered the spacecraft's ability to safely return astronauts to Earth.

title: Helldivers 2 is locking out players who use older CPUs

summary: Helldivers 2 players with older computers are facing issues running the game because it requires AVX2 support, a CPU feature available since 2013. This requirement was set by the game's developer, Arrowhead Game Studios, and its publisher, Sony.

title: A genetic tree as a movie: Moving beyond the still portrait of ancestry
snippets: Researchers have developed a statistical method that transforms traditional family trees into dynamic movies, illustrating the global migration of ancestors over time. This innovative approach not only enhances genealogical studies but also has applications in tracking disease spread and analyzing animal migration patterns across different regions.
summary: Researchers have created a new statistical method that turns family trees into dynamic movies, showing ancestors' global migration over time. This method improves genealogical research and can also be used to track disease spread and study animal migration patterns across regions.

title: Melting ice, more rain drive Southern Ocean cooling
snippets: Researchers discovered that 60% of the discrepancy between expected and actual ocean temperatures around Antarctica over several decades is due to increased meltwater and rainfall.
summary: Researchers found that increased meltwater and rainfall account for 60% of the observed difference between predicted and actual ocean temperatures around Antarctica over recent decades.

title: Long COVID patients feel pressure to prove their illness is real, study finds

summary: A recent study indicates that people with Long COVID often feel ignored, disbelieved, and unsupported by their healthcare providers.

title: Cartilage and bone development: Three paths to skeleton formation
snippets: Researchers have discovered that in vertebrates, skeletal cells from different body regions not only originate from various precursor cells but also exhibit distinct gene regulation. This variation in gene regulation among skeletal cells is believed to be crucial to the evolutionary success of vertebrates.
summary: Researchers have found that vertebrate skeletal cells come from different precursor cells and have unique gene regulation depending on their body region. This diversity in gene regulation is considered key to vertebrates' evolutionary success.

title: Terahertz imaging: Breakthrough in non-invasive cochlear visualization
snippets: Researchers have developed a non-invasive, high-resolution terahertz (THz) imaging technique to visualize cochlear structures in mice, paving the way for advanced diagnostics of hearing loss and other conditions. This method allows for 3D reconstructions, potentially leading to the creation of miniaturized THz diagnostic devices. This breakthrough could significantly improve diagnostic speed, accuracy, and patient outcomes in treating hearing loss, cancer, and beyond.
summary: Researchers have created a new non-invasive imaging technique using terahertz (THz) technology for detailed visualization of cochlear structures in mice. This method, which enables 3D reconstructions, may lead to the development of compact THz diagnostic devices. The advancement promises to enhance the diagnosis and treatment of hearing loss, cancer, and other conditions by improving speed and accuracy, potentially benefiting patient outcomes.

title: We must not ignore eugenics in our genetics curriculum, says professor
snippets: Mark Peifer, a biology professor at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, advocates for the inclusion of eugenics in college genetics curriculums. He believes this will motivate scientists to address the misuse of science for political purposes.
summary: Mark Peifer, a biology professor at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, is advocating for the inclusion of eugenics in college genetics curriculums. He argues that this will help motivate scientists to confront and address the misuse of science for political ends.
